title: Workshop on Teaching Mathematics Skills Development with Abductive Reasoning

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers explore strategies for developing mathematical skills applicable in actual classrooms, including collaborative problem-solving activities using digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically apply abductive reasoning to explain methods for approximating square roots of irrational numbers.
Learners can create math lesson designs reflecting the four core competencies of the K12 technology development framework.
Learners can improve learning strategies formed based on peer assessment feedback and evaluate their applicability in educational settings.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
